intro.p: A trial of the intravenous medication Remdesivir was conducted in {{age}}. Patients were randomly assigned to receive either Remdesivir or a placebo for up to 10 days. The primary outcome measured was the time to recover. Preliminary results from the {{n}} patients ({{n_e}} randomly assigned to get Remdesivir and {{n_p}} to get the placebo) indicated that those who received Remdesivir had a median recovery time of 11 days as compared with {{diff}} days in those who received the placebo. {{results}}

content.p: What were the results of the study

outtro.p: The group that received Remdesivir had a median recovery time that was {{answer_4}} days shorter than the placebo group's recovery time

content.p: Did the researchers use any blinding? if so, what was blinded?

outtro.p: Yes, the subjects/patients were blinded since they would not have known if they were getting a placebo or not.

content.p: Are the results generalizable to all adults?

outtro.p: No. Explanation needed, student explanations will vary
